title: Having a pro-Leave PM has changed the outlook of Brexit from fear to hope
text:
The PM has pulled off what he always said was possible

I could easily spend much more than the space allotted me in this column explaining the defects of Boris Johnson’s Brexit deal, but I shan’t. I could rage against the letting down of Northern Ireland over the customs border in the Irish Sea and VAT, or the failure to remove the ultimate jurisdiction of the European Court of Justice over so many issues which will later be disputed, or our voteless impotence in the transition period, or the size of our bill, but I shan’t. Today’s vote in the House of Commons is not ultimately about any of these things, important though all of them are.

To understand where we are now, one must go back to March...
description: The PM has pulled off what he always said was possible
